title: Ticket #370: Timestamp stdout stderr lines
description:
It would be nice if a job could ask timestamp_output=TRUE and timestamp_error=TRUE, which would cause each line of output and error to be timestamped with the time the line was started. Doing this universally might be tricky, since Condor usually just redirects output to a file, but it seems feasible for stream_output=TRUE and stream_error=TRUE, since Condor is managing it anyway.

This was a brainstormed idea from tlmiller
creator: adesmet
